all_questions.question: What happens to partial translations when they are combined with the rule?
all_questions.context: So for these partial translations, no language model score was yet applied.

all_questions.question: Why is it important to apply the rule before scoring partial translations?
all_questions.context: It is only after the rule has been applied and after the rule has put these two items together to form the bigger icon.

all_questions.question: What is a state in the hierarchical model?
all_questions.context: So the states were labeled with the non-terminal and each of the states indicated that from this position to this position there is a valid derivation that covers the whole span and that valid derivation is of type NP.

all_questions.question: What is the purpose of using boxes in bottom-up parsing?
all_questions.context: So these boxes correspond to the grammar rules. The grammar says which of these smaller bits that are on the table should you now take and wrap them in a box.

all_questions.question: What is the purpose of state splitting in the context of language model scoring on boxes?
all_questions.context: So that you can use them in the combination. Now for the purposes of the language model scoring on your box, you must put not only the label of the non-terminal, but you also need to put there the exact words that the hypothesis ended with and started with.

all_questions.question: What is the main difference between state splitting in phrase-based MT and the described method?
all_questions.context: Now it's all bottom up, so we have like two ends of history that needs to be taken care of.

all_questions.question: What is the effect of using state splitting in the system?
all_questions.context: Your search space, all the labels of the boxes that you have on your table are split to contain more information.

selected_questions.question: What is the purpose of state splitting in the context of language model scoring on boxes?
selected_questions.context: So that you can use them in the combination. Now for the purposes of the language model scoring on your box, you must put not only the label of the non-terminal, but you also need to put there the exact words that the hypothesis ended with and started with.

selected_questions.question: What happens to partial translations when they are combined with the rule?
selected_questions.context: So for these partial translations, no language model score was yet applied.
